title: Understanding Acid Dissociation
text: The acid dissociation constant, $$K_a$$, is a measure of the strength of an acid in solution. It is the equilibrium constant for the dissociation of an acid into its ions.

title: Identify the Species Involved
text: For hydrofluoric acid (HF), identify the species that are present in the dissociation reaction. What ions does HF dissociate into?

title: Formulate the $$K_a$$ Expression
text: Using the dissociation reaction, write the expression for the acid dissociation constant ($$K_a$$) for HF. Remember that Ka is the product of the concentrations of the products divided by the concentration of the reactant.
